sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten postcard from Liebstöckl to Schenker, dated January 11, 1928
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Without naming the composer or title, Liebstöckl expresses himself in very disparaging terms about Ernst Krenek and the latter's opera, Jonny spielt auf.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Liebstöckl, Hans; Schenker, Heinrich; Graf, Max; Kralik, Heinrich; Bienenfeld, Elsa; Decsey, Ernst; UE; composition

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Liebstoeckl to Schenker, dated January 11, 1928

tei:transcription.tei:p: Dr. Heinrich Maria “Maria” overwritten with “(?)”, presumably by Schenker. Perhaps Liebstöckl intended it to be a joke. Schenker Wien, III. Keilgasse, 8.

Ich drücke Ihnen die Hand. Was sagen Sie zu Graf? The allusion is to the first performance of Ernst Krenek’s Jonny spielt auf at the Vienna Staatsoper on December 31, 1927. Click on Max Graf. Graf declared himself very fond of the opera (Der Tag, January 1, 1928, pp 11–12). Heinrich Kralik expressed himself in positive terms, albeit not uncritically (Neues Wiener Tagblatt, January 1, 1928, pp 2–3). Elsa Bienenfeld published an ambivalent short review (Neues Wiener Journal, January 6, 1928, p. 18). A corresponding review by Ernst Decsey could not be traced. Zu Kralik? Click on Richard von Kralik. Zu Bienenfeld? Click on Elsa Bienenfeld. Zu Decsey? Click on Ernst Decsey. Wie die Arbeit, so die Universaledition! Krenek’s opera Jonny spielt auf was published by Universal Edition, Schenker’s principal publisher. "Wie die Arbeit, so der Lohn" is a German proverb meaning "When the work is not good, the pay is small." The implication here is: "This (wretched) composition says much about the deplorable condition of Universal Edition." Der Kompomist "Kompomist": a play on words between Mist = "shit" and Komponist = "composer." [sic] unserer Tage! Dieser Satz, diese Bässe, diese Deklamation, diese Altersschwäche in der Jugend! Coëo, ergo sum! Coëo, ergo sum: the original dictum of Descartes reads Cogito ergo sum – “I think, therefore I am.“ Liebstoeckl adapts this as "I copulate, therefore I am."

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Liebstoeckl to Schenker, dated January 11, 1928

tei:translation.tei:p: Dr. Heinrich Maria Schenker, Vienna III, Keilgasse 8.

I press your hand. What do you say to Graf? To Kralik? To Bienenfeld? To Decsey? As with the work, so with Universal Edition! The composer of our time! This counterpoint, these bass-lines, this declamation, this infirmity of youth! Coëo, ergo sum!
